clinical_study.brief_title: The Application of M-charts and Microperimetry for the Assessment of Visual Function in Patients After Vitrectomy Due to the Full Thickness Macular Hole.
clinical_study.official_title: The Application of M-charts and Microperimetry for the Assessment of Visual Function in Patients After Vitrectomy Due to the Full Thickness Macular Hole.

brief_summary.textblock: To examine the relationship between morphological and functional results in eyes after vitrectomy due to the full thickness macular hole (FTMH).

primary_outcome.description: Acuity is a measure of visual performance. The eye exam seeks to find the prescription that will provide the best corrected visual performance achievable
The Amsler grid, consisting of evenly spaced horizontal and vertical lines, has been widely used since 1947 to test the metamorphopsia.

Quantitative thickness measurements derived from the "fast macular scan" algorithm report retinal thickness at several locations including the center point, central subfield, and 4 inner and 4 outer zones of the macula.

secondary_outcome.description: Microperimetry is a procedure to assess retinal sensitivity while fundus is directly examined; it enables exact correlation between macular pathology and corresponding functional abnormality. It is a psychophysical method which is rapid, safe and non-invasive.

arm_group.description: Group of 22 patients who underwent vitrectomy due to macular hole

intervention.description: Microperimetry is a procedure to assess retinal sensitivity while fundus is directly examined; it enables exact correlation between macular pathology and corresponding functional abnormality.
The M-chart (Inami Co., Tokyo, Japan) is a diagnostic tool developed by Matsumoto to quantify the degree of metamorphopsia in patients with macular diseases.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
The diagnosed full thickness macular hole and psuedophakia.
Exclusion Criteria:
macular pseudohole, non-full thickness macular hole, retinal detachment, other ocular comorbidities.
